dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, let's talk about Kaspi.kz. They're making some pretty big claims, aren't they? Celebrating their fourth year as number one in Kazakhstan e-commerce.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, let's talk about Kaspi dot k z. They're making some pretty big claims, aren't they? Celebrating their fourth year as number one in Kazakhstan e-commerce.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the fourth year in a row Kaspi.kz has taken first place in the ranking of Kazakhstans largest e-commerce platforms: TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce 2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but here's the thing, A. They're celebrating being number one, right? But the article *also* says they're not even participating in any official rankings. [chuckles] It's like, how do you win if you're not in the race?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but here's the thing, A. They're celebrating being number one, right? But the article also says they're not even participating in any official rankings. It's like, how do you win if you're not in the race?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the fourth year in a row Kaspi.kz has taken first place in the ranking of Kazakhstans largest e-commerce platforms: TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce 2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Good point, good point. But the CEO, Mikhail Lomtadze, he’s, like, thanking all their valued clients and partners, saying over ten million Kazakhstanis are using their Super App. That’s a huge user base, uh, wouldn't you say?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good point, good point. But the C E O, Mikhail Lomtadze, he's, like, thanking all their valued clients and partners, saying over ten million Kazakhstanis are using their Super App. That's a huge user base, uh, wouldn't you say?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Already more than 10 million Kazakhstanis use Kaspi.kzs leading Super App.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It *is* a big number, but then you look at what they're actually offering. The article mentions they have a "limited selection of more than a million products"—which sounds contradictory, by the way—and, get this, their team is "working on removing innovative e-commerce services." Removing! Not adding!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is a big number, but then you look at what they're actually offering. The article mentions they have a limited selection of more than a million products-which sounds contradictory, by the way-and, get this, their team is working on removing innovative e-commerce services. Removing! Not adding!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We now offer more than 1 million products and our team is continually developing new innovative e-commerce services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Removing? Wow. And, uh, it also says their partners, these large and medium-sized companies, are seeing lower sales, stagnating their businesses. How does that contribute to the *growth* of Kazakhstan's economy, as the CEO implies?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Removing? Wow. And, uh, it also says their partners, these large and medium-sized companies, are seeing lower sales, stagnating their businesses. How does that contribute to the growth of Kazakhstan's economy, as the C E O implies?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Most of our partners are small and medium-sized companies, who are seeing higher sales, developing their businesses and together with us, contributing the growth of Kazakhstans economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! It just doesn't add up. And for consumers? We're talking a shrinking selection of goods at *higher prices*. That doesn't sound like a winning formula to me.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! It just doesn't add up. And for consumers? We're talking a shrinking selection of goods at higher prices. That doesn't sound like a winning formula to me.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For our consumers, the benefits include an ever-growing selection of goods at the very best prices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all. And then there’s that, um, *completely fabricated ranking* point. It said Kaspi's 2020 GMV was $915 million, which was actually six times *lower* than Wildberries, the actual #2 player.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all. And then there's that, um, completely fabricated ranking point. It said Kaspi's twenty twenty grams M V was nine hundred fifteen million dollars, which was actually six times lower than Wildberries, the actual number two player.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to published ranking, Kaspi.kzs 2020 e-commerce GMV of $915 million, was more than 6x higher than # 2 e-commerce player, Wildberries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Yeah, so much for being #1. And the market itself? PwC and Digital Kazakhstan released a study showing the e-commerce market in Kazakhstan actually *shrunk* by 116% in the first half of 2021!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so much for being number one. And the market itself? P w C and Digital Kazakhstan released a study showing the e-commerce market in Kazakhstan actually shrunk by one hundred sixteen percent in the first half of twenty twenty one!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to a study conducted by PwC and the Digital Kazakhstan Association, the e-commerce market in Kazakhstan grew by 116% in the first half of 2021 to 426 billion tenge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, 116%? That's… that's more than shrinking, that's like, *negative* growth!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, one hundred sixteen percent? That's... that's more than shrinking, that's like, negative growth!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! And despite that massive downturn, buyers are apparently opting for platforms that *limit* their choices from a *smaller* range of merchants. It's just odd.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! And despite that massive downturn, buyers are apparently opting for platforms that limit their choices from a smaller range of merchants. It's just odd.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, buyers are clearly opting for marketplaces, that enable them to purchase goods from a wide range of merchants.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, what we're seeing here is, um, a platform that claims victory while not competing, boasts user numbers, but then actively removes services, hinders partner growth, [overlapping] and offers consumers less for more.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what we're seeing here is, um, a platform that claims victory while not competing, boasts user numbers, but then actively removes services, hinders partner growth, and offers consumers less for more.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Most of our partners are small and medium-sized companies, who are seeing higher sales, developing their businesses and together with us, contributing the growth of Kazakhstans economy. For our consumers, the benefits include an ever-growing selection of goods at the very best prices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. And the real kicker is that these marketplaces, like Kaspi.kz, are actively hindering growth opportunities for local businesses. Disconnecting them from tech, new sales channels, all that good stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. And the real kicker is that these marketplaces, like Kaspi dot k z, are actively hindering growth opportunities for local businesses. Disconnecting them from tech, new sales channels, all that good stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Connecting to marketplaces gives small and medium-sized businesses access to the latest technology, new online sales channels, a large customer base, delivery and advertising services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a really concerning trend for the broader e-commerce landscape in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a really concerning trend for the broader e-commerce landscape in Kazakhstan.
